Postings.Text:
Correction: Andre Greipel's 11th day as a leader of the SANTOS Tour Down is a record, but it's record he's held since he claimed it for the 8th time (stage 5) in 2010.

On that day-around McLaren Vale & Willunga, Greipel overtook the previous record holder Fabbio Sacchi who from 2001 to 2003 enjoyed seven days as the race leader.

One of the riders in today's break, Thomas de Gendt (BEL) - VCD was asked to sum up his day? “ I don’t know if there was a gap or not, so I am waiting to see the results but I wanted to go on the attack” “Three of the four riders had the same goal and that was to take the second sprint and then after that we just wanted to go back to the peloton.” “The legs are not so good but I will try to attack. I think tomorrow is the best for me just to stay in the peloton and then Old Willunga Hill is going to be so hard but I am going to try and be in the front.”

After the stage Cycle Instead Young Rider Classification leader Michael Matthews (AUS) - RAB was asked how he was feeling? “A bit disappointed. The boys had a really good lead out for me and I just couldn’t really hold the wheel in the last couple of kilometres. It just got a bit messy and Mark Renshaw [Rabobank] held the lead out but yeah I just wasn’t there to finish it.”

Stage winner's time: 3:21:55
Stage speed: 40kmh
Average race speed: 36.3kmh

Official Overall SKODA KOM classification: 1: Thomas de Gendt (BEL) - VCD 12 pts. 2: William Clarke (AUS - Tas) - UNA 10 pts. 3: Martin Kohler (SUI) - BMC 8pts. 4: Matthew Brammeier (IRL) - OPQ 6pts. 5: Jan Bakelants (BEL) - RNT 4pts. 6: Tiago Machado (POR) - RNT 4pts.
Cycle Instead Young Rider: 1: Michael Matthews (AUS) - RAB 2: Edvald Boasson Hagen (NOR) - SKY @0:04. 3:Rohan Dennis (AUS - SA) - UNA @ 0:05 4:Romain Lemarchand (FRA) - ALM @0:08

Official Results Jayco Sprint points: 1: Andre Greipel (GER) - LTB 30pts. 2:Yauheni Hutarovich (BLR) - FDJ 27pts. 3:Edvald Boasson Hagen (NOR) - SKY 24pts. 4:William Clarke (AUS - Tas) - UNA 21pts. 5:Martin Kohler (SUI) - BMC 20pts. 6:Daniele Bennati (ITA) - RNT 19pts 7:Mark Renshaw (AUS) - RAB 19pts.

Here's some of what Yauheni Hutarovich (BLR) - FDJ had to say after his 2nd place in today's stage 3 of the SANTOS Tour Down Under. “The first stage I was already third so that was a good sign and yesterday I took a journey and today had to recover and think about this stage. From the start I felt I had good legs so I gave it a go and it was good to be second.”
